positive.review:
This game is so fun. You can observe or interfere as much as you want, with no limitations. Even if you just want to plop a few creatures and civilisations down and watch how the world changes, it's enthralling. I tried putting monoliths everywhere to curse my wildlife with the fruit of knowledge.

The grasshoppers kept gaining sapience one by one and trying to create civilisation, but they were still grasshoppers with like a 24-hour lifespan, so a hundred kingdoms formed and got wiped out in like one year. Eventually they got enough momentum to start agriculture and windmills, despite not having hands. They lived peacefully for 200 years, before the raccoon bandits decided to blow them to smithereens.

The cats settled on a shoreline and immediately developed racism. Despite being a relatively small kingdom, somehow they became the cultural epicentre of the world. My rhinoceroses and buffalo were naming their children and cities "Meeoow Meoww" like some sort of trend.

The dogs subjugated the chickens, naming all the chicken villages some variation of "Woof" (I'm sure it's more nuanced in their tongue) and enforcing the Woof language. They were on a conquest and close to becoming essentially the Roman Empire—before the entire kingdom burned to the ground during the Age of Sun. The next dogs to gain enlightenment weren't nearly as ambitious, and they splintered off into too many factions to stand a chance.

The frogs, turtles, and bunnies came together to form "The Titans of Darkness" and wage war on the rest of the world. Unfortunately, the frogs were wiped out tragically by an invasion of evil pumpkins, and the turtles got annexed by the garlic men. The bunnies fled and made a new kingdom called... Meow.

The swamp rats bred a mutation that turns them into walking tentacles. The goats mutated into walking rocks.

The gingerbread men are pure evil, they feast on blood, and their language drives anyone who reads it to madness.

"Am I supposed to know what I'm doing now?" - Garg the rhino, moments after gaining sapience

No, Garg, you're not. I don't either. Now fight my skeleton army. God loves you.
i love simulating civilization, so its a good game, wish they could make it so it can expand past medieval ages without mods
one of the most fun sims ive played in awhile, been playing for YEARS and its always what i come back to when i just wanna play something but I dont know what

Probably one of the best sandbox games. Not only do you also play god, but it's also very useful for worldbuilding. You can make any story you'd like from just a bunch of tiny NPCs fighting each other. Overall, I love it.
Very unique and cool game that was clearly made with love.

good game 
got xenophobic beetles to crush aliens on lord of the rings map
11/10

this game is really fun but i have four ideas that could make the game better:

1. a name searcher like you have a creature that is named bob so you'll search bob and see if there are any bobs in the world
2. when you give a name in name template in the culture i think it would be useful to add a name just for lords and kings
3. youth and elder reverence can exist together in one culture
4. creatures can inherit names from their parents

awesome game, Endless Fun
Kind Of Perfect For Anyone
Oh my, love it. Now I don't have to refund it, since i have MORE than 2 hours on this game, but why would i refund such great game? This is Peak!
A fun world-building, god-sim with many options, auto-generated lore, and an active mod/workshop community. I enjoyed it.
Holy peak. I love it - especially the new long awaited update. I think the waiting period for the update was worth it.

Bought it years ago, played it and it was nice. Now that it was updated I loved this game even more 10/10

Worldbox is one of those sandbox games that just keeps you hooked because it lets your imagination run wild. It feels relaxing and chaotic at the same time—you can build peaceful kingdoms, watch tiny civilizations grow, or unleash absolute destruction just to see how the world reacts. The little details, the quirky behaviors of the creatures, and the freedom to shape the world however you want make every session feel fresh. It’s the kind of game you can play for minutes or sink hours into without even noticing, and it always leaves you wanting to try “one more experiment.”
A god sim game. Want to simulate some people living in a desert? Ofcourse. Wanna nuke those same people? Absolutely! awesome game, I love it!

Even though it is early access I still have a ton of fun seeing how everything turns out.  I just set up a little craziness, go do something else for a bit, come back to see whatever it has turned into, and then add some more insanity.  Super fun to play.
THE Civilization Simulation game. This game gives you endless possibilities to create your own worlds that will forge their own stories on their own.

Seriously, this game is amazing and i have been playing it for years. I would reccomend anyone who likes sandbox games buying it. I do feel like devs actually care about their players and i was never disapointed by the updates.
I used to play the free version on mobile. It's a really fun game and it feels like the development team is really dedicated to making it better with every update.

This game is my favorite and, in my opinion, the BEST god game ever made. You can mess with genetics, destroy or build kingdoms, shape terrain, and mess with the little guys u can spawn. If your into god games, this is the perfect one. The fact ONE guy made this work of art is insane to me. If your thinking about buying it, BUY IT.
relaxing sandbox game with good content updates where you can either be very meticulous with how things develop in your world or you can sit back and see how things unfold
Honestly the most fun i've had in a game where I'm not controlling anything happening, seeing the civilizations grow and attack as well as all the races in the new updates just feels so fun
This game is SO much better than the name and cover photo suggest.

ts game hella fun bro. I love it some much. Would recommend you buying it 100%. Oh yeah also you have to unlock all the traits manually but its pretty easy by just going onto the workshop and downloading a world w/ all the traits.
One of the most engaging sandbox game I have ever played, highly recommended.
A simple world builder that excels where most fail. If this is incomplete, I can't wait to see what the end-state looks like.

Up until rather recently, I had dismissed this game because of how shallow the mechanics were, for it was too simplistic for the simulation it had advertised, and assumed it was a solo dev project that'd fail in EA or release to disappointment. However in the last major update Mastef (the dev) has managed to change my opinion. Genetics are just abstracted enough to not be unreadable and lead to interesting mutations, as well as give almost any animal the ability to become sapient and join a village or kingdom, which also have been expanded upon with the addition of cultures and languages that effect it as a whole. The average ai of each creature is still kind of garbage, and I hope he improves on it in the future (they still blindly stand in arrow fire, and artillery, etc.) but he has laid the groundwork for a really fun sandbox to watch nations grow and fall. If you're familiar with Dwarf Fortress legends mode, this offers a more interactive version of that, and I hope that Mastef continues to make grow this game out into something amazing.

I wanted this game for so long and finally, my friend gifted it to me. I really like the many posibilities and the fact you have a sandbox style game to be creative. You can decide if you buildt civilizations or if you want to focus on destroying everything. Grafics is pixel-style. Sounds are nice and fitting. I really like it.
Good God Sim game with unique features and a dedicated team making it better with each update.
This game genuenly stores so much data and runs perfectly fine, like HOW
Absolute peak sandbox game. So much content, you'll never run out of stuff to do in this game. Good game, good devs, you should get it

amazing game spent hours just playing for fun. then the acheivements are a commitment that i have enjoyed completely. would totally recommend this game to other. worlds best simulator. the new update was also god tier.
Cool game. It has a LOT of options, so it's for those who really like having a lot of options.
This is a cool game, but it needs improvement. Also, the price is too high for such a game
Played this on mobile before I bought it on Steam. It is fun to have in the background, even when you forget you had this running and then you find out a ton of exploding bugs destroyed everything.
This is a very good game to mess around in. It isn't super complex, it doesn't tutorial bomb you, and you can tell the dev actually cares about the game.
peak, i love watching the worlds i made have lore and stuff. Perfect game
a good game with a horrrific level of customiztionable depth. good.

This is a fun peaceful (can also not be peaceful if you choose not to) game that inspires creativity. You can also download other maps that others have made and it is fun to see what others have made.
A fun sandbox simulation game that slightly feeds my desire to control the lives of millions!
this game is fun. do it. throw some zaps, make big boom, destroy nations you cultivated. cause the zombie apocalypse. but set a time limit. otherwise youll burn out and not play for months lmao

This is One of my favorite games. i have 200 hrs in this game and i love every piece of it. i was a fan of the mobile version and probably had over 500 hrs in it. just the idea of the game is so interesting. watching Civilizations rise and fall, great wars, and being able to intervene just make the game very intesting to me. while i think that the game is not finished entirely yet, i feel it is well worth its price. 

overall 9.5/10
Weather I’m just sitting there letting it sim or actually contributing to the Chaos this game can waste so much of my time entertainingly
One of the few god games out there with so much in it despite it still being early access! Hopefully there will be more updates in the future like mod support!

Honestly one of the more unique sandbox games out there. I really like it. Easily one of my favourites on Steam (tthough I definitely need to put more hours in).

If I had to recommend anything... Brush shape plus size slider and the ability to spawn in more than one creature per click (unless I just am missing how to do so).

But again, love it. Overall charming sprite style, fun options, and neat systems at play.
it's not very precise as a simulator, but does the trick when all you want is to throw random things at each other and find out the result.

Absolutely beautiful game. It's really fun to create a world, let it run free, rename some civilizations, give them some lore in your head... and also destroy them later with the tools the game gives you.
The art style also helps you dissasociate from what you've done to all the innocent people. Really cool!
WorldBox is one of my favorite games of all time. The sandbox god aspect is (in my experience) kind of hard to come across, but worldbox captures it perfectly.

There's a lot of really cool stuff you can do. My favorite thing is to watch time pass and my civilizations evolve with different environmental events. You can use the landscape to give certain societies advantages over others when it comes to technology and war, for example, or you can give a society complete isolation and make them pushovers who eat all the time and do cool dances.

best game ever today...
very good...
meppy christmass
:D
So much fun! Make your own kingdoms, lots of races, and yea, a lot of fun. You should get it, its the best God game ever!
This game is a beautiful reminder that life is meaningless, nature is cruel, and i shouldn't be trusted with power.

This game is fun asf, you can do anything from build a happy, cute little town in a fairy land to building a rat colosseum and make rats fight a dragon to the death.
Amazing game.Would absolutely reccomend for civ builders.It's pretty much what it says.The best civ petri dish there is.So many things to do

This game is one of my fallback games when I want to do something low pressure with lots to look at to occupy myself while in a voice call or listening to a video/stream. It's fun to just plop down some people in a big map and watch them spread across it in different ways. c:
I like it but can this game get an update please because i cant play it anymore because when i try to get in it crashes
Fun little god game keeps adding many cool features.

it a great creative game where no one judges creating what you like
so it a great game and low price buy if you like to play creative
There are more features to be added, but honestly this is probably the best sandbox simulator game i've played! 10/10 game fr
Buen juego, las ultimas updates mejoraron bastante el juego
I love how fun the game is and what you can do with it, it is fun to create worlds and make civilizations and to deystory them 10/10 recommanded
If you're someone who loves the emergent storytelling of Grand Strategy games, then, Worldbox might be for you! It just keeps getting more complicated, and I love it for that.
Very great game has lot of details, mechanics and one of my favorite things is easter eggs.
Pretty fun sandbox, its entertaining to just spawn a bunch of stuff and see the pure chaos that is about to unfold, it can get old quick so maybe get it on sale, otherwise good game.
Very enjoyable game, takes awhile to unlock all the fun stuff tho

On the outside, while it does seem a bit boring, it can still be a very memorable game. Also, the new update added a ton of stuff to it, which really helps with the world simulation. Hpefully, the team keeps up the good work!

You can play this game for hours if you let yourself have fun with it. Really cool gasme that is constantly expanding what you can do and still in early access to who knows how big the actual game is going to be. i just wish there was more gods you could play as like crabzilla that would be really cool.

It's a really fun sandbox game, and pretty much worth it for the price. There's a lot of stuff to do and it took me a bit to understand how the game works (I had played it on my phone a couple years ago and it was SO much different back then), but it's fun discovering everything you can actually do.

My only problem with the game is that you do need to find stuff to actually unlock it, which is really annoying. I remember I was playing on my phone and wanting to buy premium so bad just to unlock some mobs. And now that I've bought it on PC and still had to do stuff to get the mobs I wanted? Kind of backwards in my opinion. But there's maps and tricks to get them all, so within 1 hour I had all mobs and most traits for characters. There's also traits for languages, genes, religions, clans, creatures like there's so so much content to explore and do.

There's a lot of QOL stuff too like speeding up the time by a lot, speeding it up even more within the debug menu that's easy to get into, doing some cheat stuff that doesn't turn off achievements for that world, there's some cheat stuff that does turn off achievements for that world, you can also tinker with with the world laws, or even turn off some features you don't like such as Ages. 

There's so much to do in this game and if you're looking for a good sandbox in which you have all the power, this is it. 9/10 game would recommend !! :D

This game allows alot of diffrent veritys for anyone you can make the best lands the best towns and secret.      If you summon a bunch of elves and then throw them in lava and then go to the EYE and click it you can unlock everything. I really recommend downloading it!

Okay its a really good game alot of cool features but my main problem is that it is WAY too expensive for what it is considering the premium mobile version is less than half the price Dont buy this game if your not sure, with this price you could buy something like lethal company or peak for less but ye ignoring the price its like a 9/10
Fun game to kill time and create cool scenarios.

I initially got into this game through the mobile (iOS) version, and this is a purchase I (so far) haven't regretted. This game is simplistic but mechanically in-depth through the gene and traits editor, and it's very fun just to watch silly little goobers do silly little goober things! although I already have found a bug, via the achievements where I have the achievement for 40 traits found, but not 20? (I presume this might've been broken after an update or something, or the 20 traits ach only counts trait traits, not all traits). either way, love the game, it's great fun for some unwinding.
The best god game in market so far (if anyone have more god game to recommend please lemme know).

I LOVE THIS i have 57 hrs of playtime and i love it theres so much stuff to do 10/10
I currently love using mods to
game so good that it made me feel like a true god to the point where i began to float and then burnt an orphanage down

This game was an EXTREMELY fun to play. I loved the power I had over the people in game as it allowed me to destroy an entire empire because they killed a cat. The main thing I liked about it though was watching the kingdoms advance and revolts I loved the revolts. Good game I very much recommend and also you should get the ultra realistic middle earth map it’s cool(:

It's a pretty good game with fun to collect achievements
A very satisfying and fun game to chill with and the developer keeps adding lots of intricate features that let you really micromanage things if you're into that kind of thing.

Addictive.

I find myself playing this game everyday, or at least having it in the background. It is genuinely one of my favorite games ever, probably up there with Elden Ring LMAO (completely fair and reasonable comparison, I know)
I like how it is open for creating words I mean I have played for 152 hours at time of post,it may cost money but beside other steam games it is a deal.So checkout wordbox.
This game can either be an in depth political simulator or a blow shit up simulator.
11/10 (+extra Because it's peak because... Mr josh lets it game it out played it himself!?!? How revivating! if that's how you say it ???)
Pretty fun game! gets boring fast unless you have 2 or more civilizations going.
I like watching people fight, what i recommend the creator to add is that they could build a wall for it to be like a fortress.

Very fun game and almost limitless possibilities with achievements, traits, genes etc. and the gameplay runs on its own most of the time but with a feature you can control some of the creatures by making them move and attack.

Very fun game, i love obliterating
 anything that dares to lay a finger on my favorite kingdom.

A pixel graphics God-Sim game with many, MANY different things to do, create and destroy hehe... the Devs are very active and release decently sized updates every few months that has made the game come a long way from when it was just a mobile game I believe but sometimes they add things nobody really asked for or needed like the 7,000 new sub races.

7/10 very fun and attention grabbing, my only issue is that some of the new updates add really unnecessary things to the game that just overwhelm you with options.

they added furries to the game. 
I'm not sure how to feel, but everything else is cool
Its fun but it could use a more modern stuff like planes, cars, and tanks. Also zombies should be able to use tools and armor

My only complaint is that the game doesn't have copy paste, redo, undo, more control options over the civilizations, rulerbox isn't a built-in feature, and map sizes are limited for no reason when we'll just use mods to make em bigger anyway


But those are all minor and overall the game is awesome

it's a very good game you sure play it i love the new update that helps with the countries and the dinasties. i hope that Maxim and hist team stay updating the game cus i love it and im waiting for more updates like guns or new buildings. thanks Maxim and team for WORLD BOX!!!!!!
Awesome content, love the customization for civilizations. 10/10, only wish the mobile version was like this, but I get that it's just business.
very good game for simulating human civillisations but the animals dont function exactly like a real ecosystem. 9/10
its so good, i love the bombs and other animals gives a fantisy world

Very well-thought-out game. The developer really does want to make you feel like you're capable of being in full control of every little aspect of worlds you create, and they're always adding more features to help further this idea.
best game  i can be cradzila and fun epriraments play this game
fun little game and tbh it is great to enjoy the mental strategy
good game, pretty addicting, also just funny to see how much you can do

I think this game is good for people who get bullied or picked on because it lets you have lots of power and taking your anger out on the game doesn't hurt other people like in Minecraft multiplayer.

negative.review: I like the game and i think its really cool. however i don't think the game is worth $20 which is why i'm not recommending it. It gets pretty old quick. Create a civ, watch them destroy each other. The mods are an absolute terrible experience, it took me 2 hours to figure out how to get them activated. If you want to play a really good god game that is $5 play populous the beginning.
Overpriced, and gets boring after 30 minutes of playtime

Ok, this games isn't horrible or anything. But it's not the best. It's really fun for the first week, but then you just couldn't care less after that. The fun is unlocking stuff. After that, its always the same thing. Create, war  , nuke.
Overpriced, and gets boring after 30 minutes of playtime

I tried to enjoy it, even over a few updates, but it gets boring really fast. 

I just stay there watching the clans fight each other, add some fire rain or stuff like that... But overall it's boring to me.
I like the game but after the ui update and everything its unplayable now

Не знаю, игра хорошая но если ты знаешь что делаешь, вот я не знаю что в ней делать от того мне и было скучно

Короче - игра на любителя
too expensive for not very fun
this game sucks so over priced
worst game ever don't recommend!
i cant get mods
is not worth your money dont buy
In the game, a 40-year-old man was having heart-to-heart/kiss conversations with a 5-year-old girl. Fix this

I mean, it's a good game but really, REALLY annoying. There was an update awhile ago that locked every trait and creature behind achievements or discovery. Not fun for me and not fun for others. Especially since some traits are locked behind hidden achievements or ones that are that have to be pure luck.

i used to love this game, i played it all the time, it was fun to play around with the mobs, creatures, wars, etc.

now they added a crap ton of new features, mechanics, and "depth", 70% of which i feel like is just completely unneeded.

its now unnecessarily complex and in depth, which just makes the game look much more daunting.

the UI is difficult to grasp, due to its size, and again, amount of unnecessary feature bloat.

actually, that describes the recent major update perfectly; feature bloat

not to add that 80% of the mobs are locked behind "discoveries" and "achievements"??? who had that idea??? youre telling me i paid money to be a "god" but then have to "unlock" shit?? excuse me??

it used to be so much better, but is now unnecessarily complex and bothersome to have fun in. not recommended.

Not worth it. There are no complex interactions and everything is very simple. Carnivore animals will simply kill everything even when not hungry, most sentient species will also just kill all animals and won't do husbandry. I even unleashed a dragon early game thinking it will go out on a whim or observe things, but nope, it just goes out and puts everything randomly on fire until it ran into a starter village and they killed it rather easily.

I like the game and i think its really cool. however i don't think the game is worth $20 which is why i'm not recommending it. It gets pretty old quick. Create a civ, watch them destroy each other. The mods are an absolute terrible experience, it took me 2 hours to figure out how to get them activated. If you want to play a really good god game that is $5 play populous the beginning.
Im sorry this is not a $20 game bruh. Im not bashing it, i see how it could be super fun to many but no way a $20 game.
Too samey. Things just spontaneously appear so spawning to make ecosystems or trying to experiment with anything is pointless.

Ok, this games isn't horrible or anything. But it's not the best. It's really fun for the first week, but then you just couldn't care less after that. The fun is unlocking stuff. After that, its always the same thing. Create, war  , nuke.
Overpriced, and gets boring after 30 minutes of playtime

I tried to enjoy it, even over a few updates, but it gets boring really fast. 

I just stay there watching the clans fight each other, add some fire rain or stuff like that... But overall it's boring to me.
I like the game but after the ui update and everything its unplayable now

Не знаю, игра хорошая но если ты знаешь что делаешь, вот я не знаю что в ней делать от того мне и было скучно

this game sucks so over priced
worst game ever don't recommend!
i cant get mods
is not worth your money dont buy
In the game, a 40-year-old man was having heart-to-heart/kiss conversations with a 5-year-old girl. Fix this

I mean, it's a good game but really, REALLY annoying. There was an update awhile ago that locked every trait and creature behind achievements or discovery. Not fun for me and not fun for others. Especially since some traits are locked behind hidden achievements or ones that are that have to be pure luck.

i used to love this game, i played it all the time, it was fun to play around with the mobs, creatures, wars, etc.

now they added a crap ton of new features, mechanics, and "depth", 70% of which i feel like is just completely unneeded.

its now unnecessarily complex and in depth, which just makes the game look much more daunting.

the UI is difficult to grasp, due to its size, and again, amount of unnecessary feature bloat.

actually, that describes the recent major update perfectly; feature bloat

not to add that 80% of the mobs are locked behind "discoveries" and "achievements"??? who had that idea??? youre telling me i paid money to be a "god" but then have to "unlock" shit?? excuse me??

it used to be so much better, but is now unnecessarily complex and bothersome to have fun in. not recommended.

Not worth it. There are no complex interactions and everything is very simple. Carnivore animals will simply kill everything even when not hungry, most sentient species will also just kill all animals and won't do husbandry. I even unleashed a dragon early game thinking it will go out on a whim or observe things, but nope, it just goes out and puts everything randomly on fire until it ran into a starter village and they killed it rather easily.

I like the game and i think its really cool. however i don't think the game is worth $20 which is why i'm not recommending it. It gets pretty old quick. Create a civ, watch them destroy each other. The mods are an absolute terrible experience, it took me 2 hours to figure out how to get them activated. If you want to play a really good god game that is $5 play populous the beginning.
Im sorry this is not a $20 game bruh. Im not bashing it, i see how it could be super fun to many but no way a $20 game.
